article:
'Adolph Northen' (also credited as 'Adolf Northen', Krafft p. 238
'Adolf Northern' Art.com [http://www.art.co.uk/asp/display_artist-asp/_/crid--
32861/Adolf_Northern.htm Adolf Northern Gallery] retrieved 6 July 2007 or
'Adolph Northern') Artnet [http://www.artnet.com/artist/652875/adolf-
northen.html Adolf Northen] retrieved 6 July 2007 (6 November 1828 â 28
May 1876) was a German painter.

He was born in MÃ¼nden, Hannover and was a pupil of DÃ¼sseldorf school of
painting. Champlin p. 353

Chiefly depicting battle scenes, and particularly events of the Napoleonic Wars,
Northen's most noted works include *[[French invasion of Russia
(1812)|Napoleon's retreat from Moscow]] which depicts the failure of the 1812
invasion of Russia by Napoleon *Prussian Attack, showing the Prussian divisions
of Hiller, Ryssel and Tippelskirch defeating respectively the French Imperial
Young Guard, 1st Battalions of the 2nd Grenadiers and 2nd Chasseurs at the
. Battle of Waterloo [http://www.battle-of-waterloo.com/prussian_army.htm
Prussian Army Artwork] retrieved 6 July 2007

Northern died in DÃ¼sseldorf aged 48.
